meanings.definition: The process of converting waste materials into reusable objects.
meanings.sent1: Recycling helps turn old things into new ones.
meanings.sent2: I took the cans to the recycling center.
meanings.sent3: Why did the paper go to the party? It wanted to join the recycling bin!
meanings.sent4: Her creativity was like recycling, always finding new uses for old ideas.
meanings.sent5: The magic of recycling is like giving items a second chance at life.

meanings.definition: The act of sorting and collecting materials to be reused or repurposed.
meanings.sent1: We practiced recycling by separating the paper from the plastic.
meanings.sent2: The recycling truck comes every Tuesday to pick up our bins.
meanings.sent3: Why did the plastic bottle break up with the cardboard box? It found a new love in the recycling bin!
meanings.sent4: Her dedication to recycling was like a treasure hunt for hidden gems.
meanings.sent5: The art of recycling is like giving items a second chance to shine.

meanings.definition: The practice of reusing resources to reduce waste and protect the environment.
meanings.sent1: Recycling is important for keeping our planet clean.
meanings.sent2: She believes in the power of recycling to save the Earth.
meanings.sent3: Why did the tree thank the human? For recycling its fallen leaves!
meanings.sent4: Her commitment to recycling was like a shield protecting nature.
meanings.sent5: The mission of recycling is like a superhero saving the environment.
